paper_abstract: Quantitative Structure-Property Relationship (QSPR) models to correlate the vaporization enthalpies (Delta H-vap(m)) of a set containing biphenyl and 16/26 Polychlorinated Biphenyls (PCBs) with their conceptual Density Functional Theory (DFT)-based global reactivity parameter such as electrophilicity index (omega) along with the energy of lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (E-LUMO) and the number of chlorine substituents (N-Cl) as descriptors are presented. A good coefficient of determination (r(2)=0.976/0.858) and internal predictive ability (r(CV)2 =0.948/0.758) values are obtained indicating the significance of the considered descriptors in the property analysis. The developed model is used to predict Delta H-vap(m) of the remaining 193/183 PCB congeners.
paper_title: Using QSPR models to predict the enthalpy of vaporization of 209 polychlorinated biphenyl congeners
